options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Why we say “OK”

options.label: D

options.text: Because it is only used to express disagreement.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is only used to express agreement.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: Consciousness has less to do with pure intelligence and more to do with our nature as living and breathing organisms.

options.label: C
options.text: Consciousness is not related to intelligence at all.

options.label: D
options.text: Consciousness is a product of intelligence.

multiple-choice.question: What is the brain's role in perception, according to the speaker?

options.text: The brain passively receives sensory information from the outside world.

options.label: B
options.text: The brain actively generates our experience of the world.

options.label: C
options.text: The brain is not involved in perception at all.

options.label: D
options.text: The brain only processes sensory information from the outside world.

multiple-choice.question: What is the rubber hand illusion, and what does it demonstrate?

options.label: A
options.text: The rubber hand illusion is a trick where a person's real hand is hidden from view and a fake rubber hand is placed in front of them, demonstrating the brain's ability to perceive the world accurately.

options.label: B
options.text: The rubber hand illusion is an experiment where a person's real hand is hidden from view and a fake rubber hand is placed in front of them, demonstrating the brain's ability to make predictions about the world.

options.label: C
options.text: The rubber hand illusion is a phenomenon where a person's brain is tricked into thinking a fake rubber hand is their real hand, demonstrating the brain's ability to generate our experience of the world.

options.label: D
options.text: The rubber hand illusion is a magic trick that has no scientific significance.

multiple-choice.question: What is interoception, and why is it important?

options.label: A
options.text: Interoception is the perception of the external world, and it is important for understanding how we experience reality.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Interoception is the ability to perceive objects in the world, and it is important for navigating our environment.

options.label: D
options.text: Interoception is the ability to perceive other people's thoughts, and it is important for social interaction.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Our experiences of the world are directly related to our experiences of ourselves.

options.label: C
options.text: Our experiences of the world are shaped by our experiences of ourselves.

options.label: D
options.text: Our experiences of ourselves are shaped by our experiences of the world.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: He is unsure about the possibility of creating conscious artificial intelligence.

options.label: D
options.text: He thinks it is irrelevant whether or not we can create conscious artificial intelligence.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: To write the same number on each card.

options.label: D

options.label: B

title: How to make stress your friend - Kelly McGonigal

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: C
